ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I came into this course hoping to tighten up my style and skills a little bit, and I think I've gotten closer to getting there! Through the projects we've had, I've learned a lot on how to create coherent systems, what my design style is, and how you can make effective designs with even a few small changes. I always thought that more was better, but I see that's not always the case. The projects have also helped to redefine rules and boundaries in graphic design that I was afraid to overstep or break before, but the joy of design is that there aren't any limits.
learned a lot about design history and practices that were specific to certain eras and why that was so. got to learn about the style of different graphic designers.

Typographic rules, how to adjust the same brand/style across different formats, exercises about how to rearrange/reformat predetermined content, got briefly exposed to different styles of graphic design like Modernism, Post-Modernism, and Tatami Grid, but most importantly got exposed to diverse examples of graphic design in Yale libraries e.g. Yale's visual identity, Mexican Olympics's identity manuals, children's books to learn about various formats graphic design gets used on and sequence and pacing of content.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the types of projects we worked on, but I wish there was more time in the class (or dedicated time outside of class) devoted to technical skills and the proper way to print our final projects.

This could be a strength or weakness depending on the person, but the sheer amount of projects that we had were a lot to juggle at times (Alice's class helped to train us to multi task). However, I think it was really nice to see all that we had worked on over the semester during our Final critique. It was really rewarding to see our progressions and improvements we made after in class feedback. There were some days when we just didn't have enough time for everything that was planned or to get through everyone, but I think that is a flaw for every art course.
biggest weakness is that it was on a friday from 1-5pm. had it been any other day i would have been so much more engaged

Strengths: course format and class discussions structured well for learning systems/issues in design, great open crits and participation, fun and interesting exercises and work. Weaknesses: none that I can think of atm

Trips to the Beinecke and Haas libraries were really helpful for getting inspiration from famous past examples of graphic design. We got individualized feedback from the professor because each student has a critique one by one. Projects' instructions are up on Canvas as soon as they're assigned. It can be hard to stay engaged and productive for four hours, so a student or two may not have time to get a critique. But the professor is patient, responsive, and willing to stay after class if she can and email her feedback to anyone who missed their critique.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely!!! If you are already on the design track or if you're looking to refine your design skills, I highly recommend this course. Pamela is great--super chill, encouraging and understanding. It was also really nice having lots of guests come in to give us feedback and show us the work they've been doing.
yes but maybe wait until it's not on a friday
Absolutely! Pamela is the best and really cares about everyone in the class. It was a great class!
Yes, this class is useful for graphic design majors
